text: XXVI .
text_tokenized: XXVI .

text: Mrs. Gardiner ’s caution to Elizabeth was punctually and kindly given on the first favourable opportunity of speaking to her alone : after honestly telling her what she thought , she thus went on:-- “ You are too sensible a girl , Lizzy , to fall in love merely because you are warned against it ; and , therefore , I am not afraid of speaking openly .
text_tokenized: Mrs. Gardiner ’s caution to Elizabeth was punctually and kindly given on the first favourable opportunity of speaking to her alone : after honestly telling her what she thought , she thus went on:-- “ You are too sensible a girl , Lizzy , to fall in love merely because you are warned against it ; and , therefore , I am not afraid of speaking openly .

text: Seriously , I would have you be on your guard .
text_tokenized: Seriously , I would have you be on your guard .

text: Do not involve yourself , or endeavour to involve him , in an affection which the want of fortune would make so very imprudent .
text_tokenized: Do not involve yourself , or endeavour to involve him , in an affection which the want of fortune would make so very imprudent .

text: I have nothing to say against _ him _ : he is a most interesting young man ; and if he had the fortune he ought to have , I should think you could not do better .
text_tokenized: I have nothing to say against _ him _ : he is a most interesting young man ; and if he had the fortune he ought to have , I should think you could not do better .

text: But as it is -- you must not let your fancy run away with you .
text_tokenized: But as it is -- you must not let your fancy run away with you .

text: You have sense , and we all expect you to use it .
text_tokenized: You have sense , and we all expect you to use it .

text: Your father would depend on _ your _ resolution and good conduct , I am sure .
text_tokenized: Your father would depend on _ your _ resolution and good conduct , I am sure .

text: You must not disappoint your father . ”
text_tokenized: You must not disappoint your father . ”

text: “ My dear aunt , this is being serious indeed . ” “ Yes , and I hope to engage you to be serious likewise .
text_tokenized: “ My dear aunt , this is being serious indeed . ” “ Yes , and I hope to engage you to be serious likewise .

text: “ Well , then , you need not be under any alarm .
text_tokenized: “ Well , then , you need not be under any alarm .

text: I will take care of myself , and of Mr. Wickham too . He shall not be in love with me , if I can prevent it . ”
text_tokenized: I will take care of myself , and of Mr. Wickham too . He shall not be in love with me , if I can prevent it . ”

text: “ Elizabeth , you are not serious now . ” “ I beg your pardon .
text_tokenized: “ Elizabeth , you are not serious now . ” “ I beg your pardon .

text: I will try again .
text_tokenized: I will try again .

text: At present I am not in love with Mr. Wickham
text_tokenized: At present I am not in love with Mr. Wickham

text: ; no , I certainly am not .
text_tokenized: ; no , I certainly am not .

text: But he is , beyond all comparison , the most agreeable man I ever saw -- and if he becomes really attached to me -- I believe it will be better that he should not .
text_tokenized: But he is , beyond all comparison , the most agreeable man I ever saw -- and if he becomes really attached to me -- I believe it will be better that he should not .

text: I see the imprudence of it .
text_tokenized: I see the imprudence of it .

text: Oh , _ that _ abominable Mr. Darcy !
text_tokenized: Oh , _ that _ abominable Mr. Darcy !

text: My father ’s opinion of me does me the greatest honour ; and I should be miserable to forfeit it .
text_tokenized: My father ’s opinion of me does me the greatest honour ; and I should be miserable to forfeit it .

text: My father , however , is partial to Mr. Wickham .
text_tokenized: My father , however , is partial to Mr. Wickham .

text: In short , my dear aunt , I should be very sorry to be the means of making any of you unhappy ; but since we see , every day , that where there is affection young people are seldom withheld , by immediate want of fortune , from entering into engagements with each other , how can I promise to be wiser than so many of my fellow - creatures , if I am tempted , or how am I even to know that it would be wiser to resist ?
text_tokenized: In short , my dear aunt , I should be very sorry to be the means of making any of you unhappy ; but since we see , every day , that where there is affection young people are seldom withheld , by immediate want of fortune , from entering into engagements with each other , how can I promise to be wiser than so many of my fellow - creatures , if I am tempted , or how am I even to know that it would be wiser to resist ?

text: All that I can promise you , therefore , is not to be in a hurry .
text_tokenized: All that I can promise you , therefore , is not to be in a hurry .

text: I will not be in a hurry to believe myself his first object .
text_tokenized: I will not be in a hurry to believe myself his first object .

text: When I am in company with him , I will not be wishing .
text_tokenized: When I am in company with him , I will not be wishing .

text: In short , I will do my best . ”
text_tokenized: In short , I will do my best . ”

text: “ Perhaps it will be as well if you discourage his coming here so very often .
text_tokenized: “ Perhaps it will be as well if you discourage his coming here so very often .

text: At least you should not _ remind _ your mother of inviting him . ”
text_tokenized: At least you should not _ remind _ your mother of inviting him . ”

text: “ As I did the other day , ” said Elizabeth , with a conscious smile ; “ very true , it will be wise in me to refrain from _ that _ .
text_tokenized: “ As I did the other day , ” said Elizabeth , with a conscious smile ; “ very true , it will be wise in me to refrain from _ that _ .

text: But do not imagine that he is always here so often .
text_tokenized: But do not imagine that he is always here so often .

text: It is on your account that he has been so frequently invited this week .
text_tokenized: It is on your account that he has been so frequently invited this week .

text: You know my mother ’s ideas as to the necessity of constant company for her friends .
text_tokenized: You know my mother ’s ideas as to the necessity of constant company for her friends .

text: But really , and upon my honour , I will try to do what I think to be wisest ; and now I hope you are satisfied . ”
text_tokenized: But really , and upon my honour , I will try to do what I think to be wisest ; and now I hope you are satisfied . ”

text: Her aunt assured her that she was ; and Elizabeth , having thanked her for the kindness of her hints , they parted,--a wonderful instance of advice being given on such a point without being resented .
text_tokenized: Her aunt assured her that she was ; and Elizabeth , having thanked her for the kindness of her hints , they parted,--a wonderful instance of advice being given on such a point without being resented .

text: Mr. Collins returned into Hertfordshire soon after it had been quitted by the Gardiners and Jane ; but , as he took up his abode with the Lucases , his arrival was no great inconvenience to Mrs. Bennet .
text_tokenized: Mr. Collins returned into Hertfordshire soon after it had been quitted by the Gardiners and Jane ; but , as he took up his abode with the Lucases , his arrival was no great inconvenience to Mrs. Bennet .

text: His marriage was now fast approaching ; and she was at length so far resigned as to think it inevitable , and even repeatedly to say , in an ill - natured tone , that she “ _ wished _ they might be happy . ”
text_tokenized: His marriage was now fast approaching ; and she was at length so far resigned as to think it inevitable , and even repeatedly to say , in an ill - natured tone , that she “ _ wished _ they might be happy . ”

text: Thursday was to be the wedding - day , and on Wednesday Miss Lucas paid her farewell visit ; and when she rose to take leave , Elizabeth , ashamed of her mother ’s ungracious and reluctant good wishes , and sincerely affected herself , accompanied her out of the room .
text_tokenized: Thursday was to be the wedding - day , and on Wednesday Miss Lucas paid her farewell visit ; and when she rose to take leave , Elizabeth , ashamed of her mother ’s ungracious and reluctant good wishes , and sincerely affected herself , accompanied her out of the room .

text: As they went down stairs together , Charlotte said,--
text_tokenized: As they went down stairs together , Charlotte said,--

text: “ I shall depend on hearing from you very often , Eliza .
text_tokenized: “ I shall depend on hearing from you very often , Eliza .

text: “ _ That _ you certainly shall .
text_tokenized: “ _ That _ you certainly shall .

text: “ And I have another favour to ask .
text_tokenized: “ And I have another favour to ask .

text: Will you come and see me ? ” “ We shall often meet , I hope , in Hertfordshire . ”
text_tokenized: Will you come and see me ? ” “ We shall often meet , I hope , in Hertfordshire . ”

text: “ I am not likely to leave Kent for some time .
text_tokenized: “ I am not likely to leave Kent for some time .

text: Promise me , therefore , to come to Hunsford . ” Elizabeth could not refuse , though she foresaw little pleasure in the visit .
text_tokenized: Promise me , therefore , to come to Hunsford . ” Elizabeth could not refuse , though she foresaw little pleasure in the visit .

text: “ My father and Maria are to come to me in March , ” added Charlotte , “ and I hope you will consent to be of the party .
text_tokenized: “ My father and Maria are to come to me in March , ” added Charlotte , “ and I hope you will consent to be of the party .

text: Indeed , Eliza , you will be as welcome to me as either of them .
text_tokenized: Indeed , Eliza , you will be as welcome to me as either of them .

text: The wedding took place : the bride and bridegroom set off for Kent from the church door , and everybody had as much to say or to hear on the subject as usual .
text_tokenized: The wedding took place : the bride and bridegroom set off for Kent from the church door , and everybody had as much to say or to hear on the subject as usual .

text: Elizabeth soon heard from her friend , and their
text_tokenized: Elizabeth soon heard from her friend , and their

text: correspondence was as regular and frequent as it ever had been : that it should be equally unreserved was impossible .
text_tokenized: correspondence was as regular and frequent as it ever had been : that it should be equally unreserved was impossible .

text: Elizabeth could never address her without feeling that all the comfort of intimacy was over ; and , though determined not to slacken as a correspondent , it was for the sake of what had been rather than what was .
text_tokenized: Elizabeth could never address her without feeling that all the comfort of intimacy was over ; and , though determined not to slacken as a correspondent , it was for the sake of what had been rather than what was .

text: Charlotte ’s first letters
text_tokenized: Charlotte ’s first letters

text: were received with a good deal of eagerness : there could not but be curiosity to know how she would speak of her new home , how she would like Lady Catherine , and how happy she would dare pronounce herself to be ; though , when the letters were read , Elizabeth felt that Charlotte expressed herself on every point exactly as she might have foreseen .
text_tokenized: were received with a good deal of eagerness : there could not but be curiosity to know how she would speak of her new home , how she would like Lady Catherine , and how happy she would dare pronounce herself to be ; though , when the letters were read , Elizabeth felt that Charlotte expressed herself on every point exactly as she might have foreseen .

text: She wrote cheerfully , seemed surrounded with comforts , and mentioned nothing which she could not praise .
text_tokenized: She wrote cheerfully , seemed surrounded with comforts , and mentioned nothing which she could not praise .

text: The house , furniture , neighbourhood , and roads , were all to her taste , and Lady Catherine ’s behaviour was most friendly and obliging .
text_tokenized: The house , furniture , neighbourhood , and roads , were all to her taste , and Lady Catherine ’s behaviour was most friendly and obliging .

text: It was Mr. Collins ’s picture of Hunsford and Rosings rationally softened ; and Elizabeth perceived that she must wait for her own visit there , to know the rest .
text_tokenized: It was Mr. Collins ’s picture of Hunsford and Rosings rationally softened ; and Elizabeth perceived that she must wait for her own visit there , to know the rest .

text: Jane had already written a few lines to her sister , to announce their safe arrival in London ; and when she wrote again , Elizabeth hoped it would be in her power to say something of the Bingleys .
text_tokenized: Jane had already written a few lines to her sister , to announce their safe arrival in London ; and when she wrote again , Elizabeth hoped it would be in her power to say something of the Bingleys .

text: Her impatience for this second letter was as well rewarded as impatience generally is .
text_tokenized: Her impatience for this second letter was as well rewarded as impatience generally is .

text: Jane had been a week in town , without either seeing or hearing from Caroline .
text_tokenized: Jane had been a week in town , without either seeing or hearing from Caroline .

text: She accounted for it , however , by supposing that her last letter to her friend from Longbourn had by some accident been lost .
text_tokenized: She accounted for it , however , by supposing that her last letter to her friend from Longbourn had by some accident been lost .

text: “ My aunt , ” she continued , “ is going to - morrow into that part of the town , and I shall take the opportunity of calling in Grosvenor Street . ”
text_tokenized: “ My aunt , ” she continued , “ is going to - morrow into that part of the town , and I shall take the opportunity of calling in Grosvenor Street . ”

text: She wrote again when the visit was paid , and she had seen Miss Bingley .
text_tokenized: She wrote again when the visit was paid , and she had seen Miss Bingley .

text: “ I did not think Caroline in spirits , ” were her words , “ but she was very glad to see me , and reproached me for giving her no notice of my coming to London .
text_tokenized: “ I did not think Caroline in spirits , ” were her words , “ but she was very glad to see me , and reproached me for giving her no notice of my coming to London .

text: I was right , therefore ; my last letter had never reached her .
text_tokenized: I was right , therefore ; my last letter had never reached her .

text: I inquired after their brother , of course .
text_tokenized: I inquired after their brother , of course .

text: He was well , but so much engaged with Mr. Darcy that they scarcely ever saw him .
text_tokenized: He was well , but so much engaged with Mr. Darcy that they scarcely ever saw him .

text: I found that Miss Darcy was expected to dinner : I wish I could see her .
text_tokenized: I found that Miss Darcy was expected to dinner : I wish I could see her .

text: My visit was not long , as Caroline and Mrs. Hurst were going out .
text_tokenized: My visit was not long , as Caroline and Mrs. Hurst were going out .

text: I dare say I shall soon see them here .
text_tokenized: I dare say I shall soon see them here .

text: Elizabeth shook her head over this letter .
text_tokenized: Elizabeth shook her head over this letter .

text: It convinced her that accident only could discover to Mr. Bingley her sister ’s being in town .
text_tokenized: It convinced her that accident only could discover to Mr. Bingley her sister ’s being in town .

text: Four weeks passed away , and Jane saw nothing of him .
text_tokenized: Four weeks passed away , and Jane saw nothing of him .

text: She endeavoured to persuade herself that she did not regret it ; but she could no longer be blind to Miss Bingley ’s inattention .
text_tokenized: She endeavoured to persuade herself that she did not regret it ; but she could no longer be blind to Miss Bingley ’s inattention .

text: After waiting at home every morning for a fortnight , and inventing every evening a fresh excuse for her , the visitor did at last appear ; but the shortness of her stay , and , yet more , the alteration of her manner , would allow Jane to deceive herself no longer .
text_tokenized: After waiting at home every morning for a fortnight , and inventing every evening a fresh excuse for her , the visitor did at last appear ; but the shortness of her stay , and , yet more , the alteration of her manner , would allow Jane to deceive herself no longer .

text: The letter which she wrote on this occasion to her sister will prove what she felt:-- “ My dearest Lizzy will , I am sure , be incapable of triumphing in her better judgment , at my expense , when I confess myself to have been entirely deceived in Miss Bingley ’s regard for me .
text_tokenized: The letter which she wrote on this occasion to her sister will prove what she felt:-- “ My dearest Lizzy will , I am sure , be incapable of triumphing in her better judgment , at my expense , when I confess myself to have been entirely deceived in Miss Bingley ’s regard for me .

text: But , my dear sister , though the event has proved you right , do not think me obstinate if I still assert that , considering what her behaviour was , my confidence was as natural as your suspicion .
text_tokenized: But , my dear sister , though the event has proved you right , do not think me obstinate if I still assert that , considering what her behaviour was , my confidence was as natural as your suspicion .

text: I do not at all comprehend her reason for wishing to be intimate with me ; but , if the same circumstances were to happen again , I am sure I should be deceived again .
text_tokenized: I do not at all comprehend her reason for wishing to be intimate with me ; but , if the same circumstances were to happen again , I am sure I should be deceived again .

text: Caroline did not return my visit till yesterday ; and not a note , not a line , did I receive in the meantime .
text_tokenized: Caroline did not return my visit till yesterday ; and not a note , not a line , did I receive in the meantime .

text: When she
text_tokenized: When she

text: did come , it was very evident that she had no pleasure in it ; she made a slight , formal apology for not calling before , said not a word of wishing to see me again , and was , in every respect , so altered a creature , that when she went away I was perfectly resolved to continue the acquaintance no longer .
text_tokenized: did come , it was very evident that she had no pleasure in it ; she made a slight , formal apology for not calling before , said not a word of wishing to see me again , and was , in every respect , so altered a creature , that when she went away I was perfectly resolved to continue the acquaintance no longer .

text: I pity , though I can not help blaming , her .
text_tokenized: I pity , though I can not help blaming , her .

text: She was very wrong in singling me out as she did ; I can safely say , that every advance to intimacy began on her side .
text_tokenized: She was very wrong in singling me out as she did ; I can safely say , that every advance to intimacy began on her side .

text: But I pity her , because she must feel that she has been acting wrong , and because I am very sure that anxiety for her brother is the cause of it .
text_tokenized: But I pity her , because she must feel that she has been acting wrong , and because I am very sure that anxiety for her brother is the cause of it .

text: I need not explain myself farther ; and though _ we _ know this anxiety to be quite needless , yet if she feels it , it will easily account for her behaviour to me ; and so deservedly dear as he is to his sister , whatever anxiety she may feel on his behalf is natural and amiable .
text_tokenized: I need not explain myself farther ; and though _ we _ know this anxiety to be quite needless , yet if she feels it , it will easily account for her behaviour to me ; and so deservedly dear as he is to his sister , whatever anxiety she may feel on his behalf is natural and amiable .

text: I can not but wonder , however , at her having any such fears now , because if he had at all cared about me , we must have met long , long ago .
text_tokenized: I can not but wonder , however , at her having any such fears now , because if he had at all cared about me , we must have met long , long ago .

text: He knows of my being in town , I am certain , from something she said herself ; and yet it would seem , by her manner of talking , as if she wanted to persuade herself that he is really partial to Miss Darcy .
text_tokenized: He knows of my being in town , I am certain , from something she said herself ; and yet it would seem , by her manner of talking , as if she wanted to persuade herself that he is really partial to Miss Darcy .

text: I can not understand it .
text_tokenized: I can not understand it .

text: If I were not afraid of judging harshly , I should be almost tempted to say , that there is a strong appearance of duplicity in all this .
text_tokenized: If I were not afraid of judging harshly , I should be almost tempted to say , that there is a strong appearance of duplicity in all this .

text: I will endeavour to banish every painful thought , and think only of what will make me happy , your affection , and the invariable kindness of my dear uncle and aunt . Let me hear from you very soon .
text_tokenized: I will endeavour to banish every painful thought , and think only of what will make me happy , your affection , and the invariable kindness of my dear uncle and aunt . Let me hear from you very soon .

text: Miss Bingley said something of his never returning to Netherfield again , of giving up the house , but not with any certainty .
text_tokenized: Miss Bingley said something of his never returning to Netherfield again , of giving up the house , but not with any certainty .

text: We had better not mention it .
text_tokenized: We had better not mention it .

text: I am extremely glad that you have such pleasant accounts from our friends at Hunsford .
text_tokenized: I am extremely glad that you have such pleasant accounts from our friends at Hunsford .

text: Pray go to see them , with Sir William and Maria .
text_tokenized: Pray go to see them , with Sir William and Maria .

text: I am sure you will be very comfortable there . “ Yours , etc . ” This letter gave Elizabeth some pain ; but her spirits returned , as she considered that Jane would no longer be duped , by the sister at least .
text_tokenized: I am sure you will be very comfortable there . “ Yours , etc . ” This letter gave Elizabeth some pain ; but her spirits returned , as she considered that Jane would no longer be duped , by the sister at least .

text: All expectation from the brother was now absolutely over .
text_tokenized: All expectation from the brother was now absolutely over .

text: She would not even wish for any renewal of his attentions .
text_tokenized: She would not even wish for any renewal of his attentions .

text: His character sunk on every review of it ; and , as a punishment for him , as well as a possible advantage to Jane , she seriously hoped he might really soon marry
text_tokenized: His character sunk on every review of it ; and , as a punishment for him , as well as a possible advantage to Jane , she seriously hoped he might really soon marry

text: Mr. Darcy ’s sister , as , by Wickham ’s account , she would make him abundantly regret what he had thrown away
text_tokenized: Mr. Darcy ’s sister , as , by Wickham ’s account , she would make him abundantly regret what he had thrown away

text: Mrs. Gardiner about this time reminded Elizabeth of her promise concerning that gentleman , and required information ; and Elizabeth had such to send as might rather give contentment to her aunt than to herself .
text_tokenized: Mrs. Gardiner about this time reminded Elizabeth of her promise concerning that gentleman , and required information ; and Elizabeth had such to send as might rather give contentment to her aunt than to herself .

text_tokenized: His

text_tokenized: partiality

text: had subsided , his attentions were over
text_tokenized: had subsided , his attentions were over

text: , he was the admirer of some one else .
text_tokenized: , he was the admirer of some one else .

text: Elizabeth was watchful enough to see it all , but she could see it and write of it without material pain .
text_tokenized: Elizabeth was watchful enough to see it all , but she could see it and write of it without material pain .

text: Her heart had been but slightly touched , and her vanity was satisfied with believing that _ she _ would have been his only choice , had fortune permitted it .
text_tokenized: Her heart had been but slightly touched , and her vanity was satisfied with believing that _ she _ would have been his only choice , had fortune permitted it .

text: The sudden acquisition of ten thousand pounds was the most remarkable charm of the young lady to whom he was now rendering himself agreeable ; but Elizabeth , less clear - sighted perhaps in this case than in Charlotte ’s , did not quarrel with him for his wish of independence . Nothing , on the contrary , could be more natural ; and , while able to suppose that it cost him a few struggles to relinquish her , she was ready to allow it a wise and desirable measure for both , and could very sincerely wish him happy .
text_tokenized: The sudden acquisition of ten thousand pounds was the most remarkable charm of the young lady to whom he was now rendering himself agreeable ; but Elizabeth , less clear - sighted perhaps in this case than in Charlotte ’s , did not quarrel with him for his wish of independence . Nothing , on the contrary , could be more natural ; and , while able to suppose that it cost him a few struggles to relinquish her , she was ready to allow it a wise and desirable measure for both , and could very sincerely wish him happy .

text: All this was acknowledged to Mrs. Gardiner ; and , after relating the circumstances , she thus went on:--“I am now convinced , my dear aunt , that I have never been much in love ; for had I really experienced that pure and elevating passion , I should at present detest his very name , and wish him all manner of evil .
text_tokenized: All this was acknowledged to Mrs. Gardiner ; and , after relating the circumstances , she thus went on:--“I am now convinced , my dear aunt , that I have never been much in love ; for had I really experienced that pure and elevating passion , I should at present detest his very name , and wish him all manner of evil .

text: But my feelings are not only cordial towards _ him _ , they are even impartial towards Miss King .
text_tokenized: But my feelings are not only cordial towards _ him _ , they are even impartial towards Miss King .

text: I can not find out that I hate her at all , or that I am in the least unwilling to think her a very good sort of girl .
text_tokenized: I can not find out that I hate her at all , or that I am in the least unwilling to think her a very good sort of girl .

text: There can be no love in all this .
text_tokenized: There can be no love in all this .

text: My watchfulness has been effectual ; and though I should certainly be a more interesting object to all my acquaintance , were I distractedly in love with him , I can not say that I regret my comparative insignificance . Importance may sometimes be purchased too dearly .
text_tokenized: My watchfulness has been effectual ; and though I should certainly be a more interesting object to all my acquaintance , were I distractedly in love with him , I can not say that I regret my comparative insignificance . Importance may sometimes be purchased too dearly .

text: Kitty and Lydia take his defection much more to heart than I do .
text_tokenized: Kitty and Lydia take his defection much more to heart than I do .

text: They are young in the ways of the world , and not yet open to the mortifying conviction that handsome young men must have something to live on as well as the plain . ” [ Illustration : “ On the Stairs ” ]
text_tokenized: They are young in the ways of the world , and not yet open to the mortifying conviction that handsome young men must have something to live on as well as the plain . ” [ Illustration : “ On the Stairs ” ]

text: XXVII . With no greater events than these in the Longbourn family , and otherwise diversified by little beyond the walks to Meryton , sometimes dirty and sometimes cold , did January and February pass away .
text_tokenized: XXVII . With no greater events than these in the Longbourn family , and otherwise diversified by little beyond the walks to Meryton , sometimes dirty and sometimes cold , did January and February pass away .

text: March was to take Elizabeth to Hunsford .
text_tokenized: March was to take Elizabeth to Hunsford .

text: She had not at first thought very seriously of going thither ; but Charlotte , she soon found , was depending on the plan , and she gradually learned to consider it herself with greater pleasure as well as greater certainty .
text_tokenized: She had not at first thought very seriously of going thither ; but Charlotte , she soon found , was depending on the plan , and she gradually learned to consider it herself with greater pleasure as well as greater certainty .

text: Absence had increased her desire of seeing Charlotte again , and weakened her disgust of Mr. Collins .
text_tokenized: Absence had increased her desire of seeing Charlotte again , and weakened her disgust of Mr. Collins .

text: There was novelty in the scheme ; and as , with such a mother and such uncompanionable sisters , home could not be faultless , a little change was not unwelcome for its own sake .
text_tokenized: There was novelty in the scheme ; and as , with such a mother and such uncompanionable sisters , home could not be faultless , a little change was not unwelcome for its own sake .

text: The journey would , moreover , give her a peep at Jane ; and , in short , as the time drew near , she would have been very sorry for any delay .
text_tokenized: The journey would , moreover , give her a peep at Jane ; and , in short , as the time drew near , she would have been very sorry for any delay .

text: Everything , however , went on smoothly , and was finally settled according to Charlotte ’s first sketch .
text_tokenized: Everything , however , went on smoothly , and was finally settled according to Charlotte ’s first sketch .

text: She was to accompany Sir William and his second daughter .
text_tokenized: She was to accompany Sir William and his second daughter .

text: The improvement of spending a night in London was added in time , and the plan became as perfect as plan could be .
text_tokenized: The improvement of spending a night in London was added in time , and the plan became as perfect as plan could be .

text: The only pain was in leaving her father , who would certainly miss her , and who , when it came to the point , so little liked her going , that he told her to write to him , and almost promised to answer her letter .
text_tokenized: The only pain was in leaving her father , who would certainly miss her , and who , when it came to the point , so little liked her going , that he told her to write to him , and almost promised to answer her letter .

text: The farewell between herself and Mr. Wickham was perfectly friendly ; on his side even more .
text_tokenized: The farewell between herself and Mr. Wickham was perfectly friendly ; on his side even more .

text: His present pursuit could not make him forget that Elizabeth had been the first to excite and to deserve his attention , the first to listen and to pity , the first to be admired ; and in his manner of bidding her adieu , wishing her every enjoyment , reminding her of what she was to expect in Lady Catherine de Bourgh , and trusting their opinion of her -- their opinion of everybody -- would always coincide , there was a solicitude , an interest , which she felt must ever attach her to him with a most sincere regard ; and she parted from him convinced , that , whether married or single , he must always be her model of the amiable and pleasing . Her fellow - travellers the next day were not of a kind to make her think him less agreeable .
text_tokenized: His present pursuit could not make him forget that Elizabeth had been the first to excite and to deserve his attention , the first to listen and to pity , the first to be admired ; and in his manner of bidding her adieu , wishing her every enjoyment , reminding her of what she was to expect in Lady Catherine de Bourgh , and trusting their opinion of her -- their opinion of everybody -- would always coincide , there was a solicitude , an interest , which she felt must ever attach her to him with a most sincere regard ; and she parted from him convinced , that , whether married or single , he must always be her model of the amiable and pleasing . Her fellow - travellers the next day were not of a kind to make her think him less agreeable .

text: Sir William Lucas , and his daughter Maria , a good - humoured girl , but as empty - headed as himself , had nothing to say that could be worth hearing , and were listened to with about as much delight as the rattle of the chaise .
text_tokenized: Sir William Lucas , and his daughter Maria , a good - humoured girl , but as empty - headed as himself , had nothing to say that could be worth hearing , and were listened to with about as much delight as the rattle of the chaise .

text: Elizabeth loved absurdities , but she had known Sir William ’s too long .
text_tokenized: Elizabeth loved absurdities , but she had known Sir William ’s too long .

text: He could tell her nothing new of the wonders of his presentation and knighthood ; and his civilities were worn out , like his information .
text_tokenized: He could tell her nothing new of the wonders of his presentation and knighthood ; and his civilities were worn out , like his information .

text: It was a journey of only twenty - four miles , and they began it so early as to be in Gracechurch Street by noon .
text_tokenized: It was a journey of only twenty - four miles , and they began it so early as to be in Gracechurch Street by noon .

text: As they drove to Mr. Gardiner ’s door , Jane was at a drawing - room window watching their arrival : when they entered the passage , she was there to welcome them , and Elizabeth , looking earnestly in her face , was pleased to see it healthful and lovely as ever .
text_tokenized: As they drove to Mr. Gardiner ’s door , Jane was at a drawing - room window watching their arrival : when they entered the passage , she was there to welcome them , and Elizabeth , looking earnestly in her face , was pleased to see it healthful and lovely as ever .

text: On the stairs were a troop of little boys and girls , whose eagerness for their cousin ’s appearance would not allow them to wait in the drawing - room , and whose shyness , as they had not seen her for a twelvemonth , prevented their coming lower .
text_tokenized: On the stairs were a troop of little boys and girls , whose eagerness for their cousin ’s appearance would not allow them to wait in the drawing - room , and whose shyness , as they had not seen her for a twelvemonth , prevented their coming lower .

text: All was joy and kindness .
text_tokenized: All was joy and kindness .

text: The day passed most pleasantly away ; the morning in bustle and shopping , and the evening at one of the theatres .
text_tokenized: The day passed most pleasantly away ; the morning in bustle and shopping , and the evening at one of the theatres .

text: Elizabeth then contrived to sit by her aunt .
text_tokenized: Elizabeth then contrived to sit by her aunt .

text: Their first subject was her sister ; and she was more grieved than astonished to hear , in reply to her minute inquiries , that though Jane always struggled to support her spirits , there were periods of dejection .
text_tokenized: Their first subject was her sister ; and she was more grieved than astonished to hear , in reply to her minute inquiries , that though Jane always struggled to support her spirits , there were periods of dejection .

text: It was reasonable , however , to hope that they would not continue long .
text_tokenized: It was reasonable , however , to hope that they would not continue long .

text: Mrs. Gardiner gave her the particulars also of Miss Bingley ’s visit in Gracechurch Street , and repeated conversations occurring at different times between Jane and herself , which proved that the former had , from her heart , given up the acquaintance . Mrs. Gardiner then rallied her niece on Wickham ’s desertion , and complimented her on bearing it so well .
text_tokenized: Mrs. Gardiner gave her the particulars also of Miss Bingley ’s visit in Gracechurch Street , and repeated conversations occurring at different times between Jane and herself , which proved that the former had , from her heart , given up the acquaintance . Mrs. Gardiner then rallied her niece on Wickham ’s desertion , and complimented her on bearing it so well .

text: “ But , my dear Elizabeth , ” she added , “ what sort of girl is Miss King ?
text_tokenized: “ But , my dear Elizabeth , ” she added , “ what sort of girl is Miss King ?

text: I should be sorry to think our friend mercenary . ”
text_tokenized: I should be sorry to think our friend mercenary . ”

text: “ Pray , my dear aunt , what is the difference in matrimonial affairs , between the mercenary and the prudent motive ?
text_tokenized: “ Pray , my dear aunt , what is the difference in matrimonial affairs , between the mercenary and the prudent motive ?

text: Where does discretion end , and avarice begin ?
text_tokenized: Where does discretion end , and avarice begin ?

text: Last Christmas you were afraid of his marrying me , because it would be imprudent ; and now , because he is trying to get a girl with only ten thousand pounds , you want to find out that he is mercenary . ” “ If you will only tell me what sort of girl Miss King is , I shall know what to think . ” “ She is a very good kind of girl , I believe .
text_tokenized: Last Christmas you were afraid of his marrying me , because it would be imprudent ; and now , because he is trying to get a girl with only ten thousand pounds , you want to find out that he is mercenary . ” “ If you will only tell me what sort of girl Miss King is , I shall know what to think . ” “ She is a very good kind of girl , I believe .

text: I know no harm of her . ”
text_tokenized: I know no harm of her . ”

text: “ But he paid her not the smallest attention till her grandfather ’s death made her mistress of this fortune ? ”
text_tokenized: “ But he paid her not the smallest attention till her grandfather ’s death made her mistress of this fortune ? ”

text: “ No -- why should he ?
text_tokenized: “ No -- why should he ?

text: If it were not allowable for him to gain _ my _ affections , because I had no money , what occasion could there be for making love to a girl whom he did not care about , and who was equally poor ? ”
text_tokenized: If it were not allowable for him to gain _ my _ affections , because I had no money , what occasion could there be for making love to a girl whom he did not care about , and who was equally poor ? ”

text: “ But there seems indelicacy in directing his attentions towards her so soon after this event . ” “ A man in distressed circumstances has not time for all those elegant decorums which other people may observe .
text_tokenized: “ But there seems indelicacy in directing his attentions towards her so soon after this event . ” “ A man in distressed circumstances has not time for all those elegant decorums which other people may observe .

text: If _ she _ does not object to it , why should _ we _ ? ”
text_tokenized: If _ she _ does not object to it , why should _ we _ ? ”

text: “ _ Her _ not objecting does not justify _ him _ .
text_tokenized: “ _ Her _ not objecting does not justify _ him _ .

text: It only shows her being deficient in something herself -- sense or feeling . ”
text_tokenized: It only shows her being deficient in something herself -- sense or feeling . ”

text: “ Well , ” cried Elizabeth , “ have it as you choose .
text_tokenized: “ Well , ” cried Elizabeth , “ have it as you choose .

text: _ He _ shall be mercenary , and _ she _ shall be foolish . ”
text_tokenized: _ He _ shall be mercenary , and _ she _ shall be foolish . ”

text: “ No , Lizzy , that is what I do _ not _ choose .
text_tokenized: “ No , Lizzy , that is what I do _ not _ choose .

text: I should be sorry , you know , to think ill of a young man who has lived so long in Derbyshire . ”
text_tokenized: I should be sorry , you know , to think ill of a young man who has lived so long in Derbyshire . ”

text: “ Oh , if that is all , I have a very poor opinion of young men who live in Derbyshire ; and their intimate friends who live in Hertfordshire are not much better .
text_tokenized: “ Oh , if that is all , I have a very poor opinion of young men who live in Derbyshire ; and their intimate friends who live in Hertfordshire are not much better .

text: I am sick of them all .
text_tokenized: I am sick of them all .

text: Thank heaven !
text_tokenized: Thank heaven !

text: I am going to - morrow where I shall find a man who has not one agreeable quality , who has neither manners nor sense to recommend him .
text_tokenized: I am going to - morrow where I shall find a man who has not one agreeable quality , who has neither manners nor sense to recommend him .

text: Stupid men are the only ones worth knowing , after all . ” “ Take care , Lizzy ; that speech savours strongly of disappointment .
text_tokenized: Stupid men are the only ones worth knowing , after all . ” “ Take care , Lizzy ; that speech savours strongly of disappointment .

text: Before they were separated by the conclusion of the play , she had the unexpected happiness of an invitation to accompany her uncle and aunt in a tour of pleasure which they proposed taking in the summer .
text_tokenized: Before they were separated by the conclusion of the play , she had the unexpected happiness of an invitation to accompany her uncle and aunt in a tour of pleasure which they proposed taking in the summer .

text: “ We have not quite determined how far it shall carry us , ” said Mrs. Gardiner ; “ but perhaps , to the Lakes . ”
text_tokenized: “ We have not quite determined how far it shall carry us , ” said Mrs. Gardiner ; “ but perhaps , to the Lakes . ”

text: No scheme could have been more agreeable to Elizabeth , and her acceptance of the invitation was most ready and grateful .
text_tokenized: No scheme could have been more agreeable to Elizabeth , and her acceptance of the invitation was most ready and grateful .

text: “ My dear , dear aunt , ” she rapturously cried , “ what delight ! what felicity !
text_tokenized: “ My dear , dear aunt , ” she rapturously cried , “ what delight ! what felicity !

text: You give me fresh life and vigour .
text_tokenized: You give me fresh life and vigour .

text: Adieu to disappointment and spleen .
text_tokenized: Adieu to disappointment and spleen .

text: What are men to rocks and mountains ?
text_tokenized: What are men to rocks and mountains ?

text: Oh , what hours of transport we shall spend !
text_tokenized: Oh , what hours of transport we shall spend !

text: And when we _ do _ return , it shall not be like other travellers , without being able to give one accurate idea of anything .
text_tokenized: And when we _ do _ return , it shall not be like other travellers , without being able to give one accurate idea of anything .

text: We _ will _ know where we have gone -- we _ will _ recollect what we have seen .
text_tokenized: We _ will _ know where we have gone -- we _ will _ recollect what we have seen .

text: Lakes , mountains , and rivers , shall not be jumbled together in our imaginations ; nor , when we attempt to describe any particular scene , will we begin quarrelling about its relative situation .
text_tokenized: Lakes , mountains , and rivers , shall not be jumbled together in our imaginations ; nor , when we attempt to describe any particular scene , will we begin quarrelling about its relative situation .

text: Let _ our _ first effusions be less insupportable than those of the generality of travellers . ”
text_tokenized: Let _ our _ first effusions be less insupportable than those of the generality of travellers . ”
